intro: Lachenalia montana, commonly known as the mountain lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing vibrant yellow to orange blooms. Lachenalia montana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in arid conditions.
